caption.p: Systematic optimization of 12 drugs in combination with AI‐medicine. A) Efficacy of the 72 anti‐viral drug combinations. Viral infection rates compared to no drug treatment at 12 h (bar plot and left y‐axis) of the 72 combinations and their accumulative equivalent doses (line plot and right y‐axis). Error bars show standard deviations ( n = 3). The anti‐viral scores of each single drug and their quantatitive interactions with other drugs at B) 12 h and C) 24 h are provided. The ranks of drugs were determined by hierarchical clustering. The top 5 contributing drugs and their interactions are tagged with red boxes. Abbreviations: AMT, Amantadine HCl; NPX, Naproxen Sodium; RTN, Ritonavir; DEX, Dexamethasone; FLX, Fluoxetine HCl; LPN, Lopinavir; AZT, Azithromycin; LRT, Loratadine; DOX, Doxycycline; CLR, Chloroquine Diphosphate; OMP, Omeprazole Sodium; RBV, Ribavirin.
